name: busybox-1.19.2
notes: It is recommended to check broader vulnerability databases or consider common vulnerabilities in BusyBox. This version was released in 2015 and may contain unrecorded vulnerabilities.

name: vsftpd-3.0.2
location: bin/vsftpd (Found in strings output with pattern 'vsftpd: version 3.0.2')
description: vsftpd version 3.0.2 was identified with one known vulnerability (CVE-2015-1419) that allows remote attackers to bypass access restrictions via unknown vectors related to deny_file parsing.

name: minidlna-1.1.4
description: MiniDLNA version 1.1.4 was found in the firmware. No known CVEs were found in the NVD database for this specific version.
notes: It is recommended to monitor security bulletins for MiniDLNA, as the NVD may not have included all vulnerabilities. Additionally, checking other vulnerability databases such as Exploit-DB for relevant vulnerability reports is advisable.

name: nginx-1.2.2
description: nginx version 1.2.2 was identified in the firmware. This appears to be a custom build for a specific embedded platform (ARM architecture). No CVEs were found in the NVD database for this specific version.

name: dhcpcd-1.3.22-pl4
description: dhcpcd version 1.3.22-pl4 was identified with two known vulnerabilities (CVE-2002-1403 and CVE-2005-1848). CVE-2002-1403 allows local users to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters, and CVE-2005-1848 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service.
notes: It is recommended to upgrade to the latest version to fix known vulnerabilities.

name: miniupnpd-1.4
description: MiniUPnPd version 1.4 was identified, likely a Tenda-modified version based on the version string 'FH1209/1.0.0.0 UPnP/1.0 MiniUPnPd/1.4'. No specific CVEs were identified for this version.
